title: Crittercams Investigate Seal Mystery
description: August 16—The rising number of Hawaiian monk seals on the main Hawaiian Islands is a boon for conservationists. But some local businesses and fishermen view them as a nuisance. Following a spate of seal killings, scientists use National Geographic Critter

asset.author: NationalGeographic
asset.hookText:
August 16—The rising number of Hawaiian monk seals on the main Hawaiian Islands is a boon for conservationists. But some local businesses and fishermen view them as a nuisance. Following a spate of seal killings, scientists use National Geographic Crittercams to dispel myths about how these endangered creatures really behave in the wild.

Read the article from National Geographic News:
http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2013/08/130819-hawaiian-monk-seal-crittercam-conservation-ocean-science/
